Create a visual representation of the curriculum: To help you understand the curriculum better, create a visual representation such as a flowchart or a mind map. This can help you see the bigger picture and how all the pieces fit together.
Break it down into smaller tasks: If the new curriculum seems overwhelming, break it down into smaller tasks. Focus on one task at a time and work your way through the curriculum.

Find a study group: Join a study group with classmates who are also struggling with the new curriculum. This can provide a supportive environment where you can share your struggles and learn from each other.
Ask for help: Don't be afraid to ask for help from your teacher or a tutor. They can provide guidance and support to help you understand the curriculum.
Take breaks: It's important to take breaks and give yourself time to rest and recharge. This can help you come back to the curriculum with a fresh perspective and renewed energy.
